text: Liselotte Pulver (born 11 October 1929), sometimes credited as Lilo Pulver, is a Swiss actress. Pulver was one of the stars of German cinema in the 1950s and 1960s, where she often was cast as a tomboy."Das sch√∂nste Lachen des Films" , Focus (11 October 2009) Her breakthrough movie role was "Vreneli", the wife of the lead in Uli, der Knecht (1954). She was James Cagney's secretary in Billy Wilder's comedy One, Two, Three (1961). In 1963, for her role as a Russian woman in A Global Affair, she was nominated for a Golden Globe Award as best supporting actress. ==References== Category:1929 births Category:Living people Category:People from Bern Category:Swiss movie actors Category:Swiss television actors Category:Swiss stage actors
title: Liselotte Pulver
